intro: Surfacea bracteata, commonly known as the bracted surfacea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive bracts that enclose the inflorescence, giving it a unique appearance. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture.
